isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - TURBOCHARGERS - RECONDITIONING - REPLACEMENT CORE ASSEMBLY

note.para: When it is not cost-effective to completely disassemble and recondition the turbocharger, a replacement core assembly is available for service. When using this unit, it is only necessary to remove the compressor and turbine housings from the old unit and install them on the new core assembly. BE SURE CORRECT ALIGNMENT IS ACHIEVED SINCE THE CENTER HOUSING ON THE NEW CORE ASSEMBLY WILL NOT HAVE ALIGNMENT MARKS.
DO NOT REST CENTER HOUSING ON EITHER COMPRESSOR IMPELLER OR TURBINE WHEEL OR DAMAGE TO WHEEL ASSEMBLY MAY RESULT.

step1.para:
Remove the lock nut from the turbine shaft ( Figure 2.28
) as follows:

step2.para: Construct shaft holding fixture using bar stock and a socket.
Support the center housing and shaft assembly vertically in the holding fixture and vice.
Attach a socket and tee-handle wrench to the lock nut. Turn the tee-handle wrench to remove the lock nut. Keep wrench straight.
Slide compressor wheel from turbine shaft.

note.para: If carbon buildup prevents easy removal, press the shaft from the compressor impeller as explained in Step 2.
DO NOT APPLY SIDE THRUST WHEN LOOSENING THE LOCK NUT AS IT IS POSSIBLE TO BEND THE SHAFT.

step1.para:
Support center housing assembly on an arbor press as shown in Figure 2.29
. Grind a radius on the end of a 1/4 inch bolt to fit the end of the shaft. Press the shaft from compressor wheel.

note.para: HOLD TURBINE WHEEL AND SHAFT ASSEMBLY TO PREVENT DAMAGE DUE TO DROPPING.

figure.caption: Figure 2.29 Separating Compressor Impeller from Turbine Shaft.

step1.para:
Place the center housing and back plate on a bench and remove the capscrews and washers which secure the center housing to the back plate. Refer to Figure 2.30
. Carefully lift the center housing from the back plate.
With the back plate removed, the following are easily removed:

step2.para:
Remove the seal ring, thrust collar and thrust washer from the center housing ( Figure 2.31
). The thrust spring located in the back plate is replaceable, but should not be removed unless replacement is necessary.

Using snap ring tool, remove the outboard bearing retainers and bearings from each side of the center housing. Refer to Figure 2.32
.

figure.caption: Figure 2.30 Center Housing and Back Plate Disassembly.
Figure 2.31 Center Housing and Back Plate Components.

note.para: The inboard retainers are subject to distortion during removal. Replace the inboard retainers ONLY if they appear to be damaged or worn.

step2.para:
Remove the piston ring from the thrust collar using a small screwdriver to carefully pry it free. Refer to Figure 2.33
.
Remove the piston ring from the turbine wheel and shaft assembly near the shroud, by carefully prying it free with a small screwdriver.
